      • readInputStreamToBuffer

        public static java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream readInputStreamToBuffer(java.io.InputStream in,
                                                    boolean sshHandling)
                                                             throws java.io.IOException
        Reads from an InputStream into a ByteArrayOutputStream.

        Includes special handling for IO streams used by the trilead SSH library that avoids running in a deadlock if the remote SSH endpoint misbehaves. This behaviour is enabled by setting #sshHandling to true.

        More specifically, it peeks (non-blocking) into the stream via InputStream.available() (in addition to the blocking read via InputStream.read(byte[])) as an extra-measure of detecting the end of the stream. This is because in some edge-cases, the InputStream.read(byte[]) blocks instead of returning when the end of the stream is reached.
        Parameters:
        in - input stream
        sshHandling - Set to true when reading an IO stream (stdin, stdout, stderr) of an SSH connection, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - See SingleThreadStdoutStderr.java See SingleThreadStdoutStderr example
        See Also:
        readInputStreamSSH(InputStream), readUrlToBuffer(InputStream)

      • readInputStreamToByteArray

        public static byte[] readInputStreamToByteArray(java.io.InputStream in)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an InputStream into a byte-array using the apache commons io library. Also tries to close the Stream when the operation is finished.
        Parameters:
        in - The stream to be written into a Byte Array. Will be closed after a successful copy.
        Returns:
        An Array of bytes read from the given InputStream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readInputStreamSSH

        public static java.lang.String readInputStreamSSH(java.io.InputStream in)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        To be used when handling i/o streams via the trilead SSH library.

        For any other kind of stream, use readUrl(InputStream)
        Parameters:
        in - input stream (stdin, stdout, stderr of an SSH connection)
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        readInputStreamToBuffer(InputStream, boolean), readUrlToBuffer(InputStream)

        Parameters:
        source - source folder
        destination - target folder (will be created, if it does not exist)
        filter - only files/folders accepted by this FileFilter are copied

      • throwWrappedException

        public static java.lang.Exception throwWrappedException(java.lang.Throwable t)
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws the provided Throwable. If if is a sub-type of Exception, it is thrown directly, everything else (sub-types of Error) is wrapped into an Exception with the Throwable specified as exception cause.
        Parameters:
        t - throwable to throw
        Returns:
        thrown exception. This exception is of course never returned, but can be used like this to tell the compiler that an exception is thrown 
                try {
                // ...
        }
        catch (Throwable t) {
                throw GenUtil.throwWrappedException(t.getCause());
        }
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
